  48. module Lexer = Debugger_lexer

  50. (** Instructions, variables and infos lists. **)
  51. ‌type dbg_instruction =
  52.   { instr_name: string;                 (* Name of command *)
  53.     instr_prio: bool;                   (* Has priority *)
  54.     instr_action: formatter -> lexbuf -> unit;
  55.                                         (* What to do *)
  56.     instr_repeat: bool;                 (* Can be repeated *)
  57.     instr_help: string }                (* Help message *)

  59. ‌let instruction_list = ref ([] : dbg_instruction list)

  61. ‌type dbg_variable =
  62.   { var_name: string;                   (* Name of variable *)
  63.     var_action: (lexbuf -> unit) * (formatter -> unit);
  64.                                         (* Reading, writing fns *)
  65.     var_help: string }                  (* Help message *)

  67. ‌let variable_list = ref ([] : dbg_variable list)

  69. ‌type dbg_info =
  70.   { info_name: string;                  (* Name of info *)
  71.     info_action: lexbuf -> unit;        (* What to do *)
  72.     info_help: string }                 (* Help message *)

  74. ‌let info_list = ref ([] : dbg_info list)

  76. (** Utilities. **)
  77. ‌let error text =
  78.   eprintf "%s@." text;
  79.   raise Toplevel

  81. ‌let check_not_windows feature =
  82.   match Sys.os_type with
  83.   | "Win32" ->
  84.       error ("\'"^feature^"\' feature not supported on Windows")
  85.   | _ ->
  86.       ()

  88. ‌let eol =
  89.   end_of_line Lexer.lexeme

  91. ‌let matching_elements list name instr =
  92.   List.filter (function a -> isprefix instr (name a)) !list

  94. let all_matching_instructions =
  95.   matching_elements instruction_list (fun i -> i.instr_name)

  97. (* itz 04-21-96 don't do priority completion in emacs mode *)
  98. (* XL 25-02-97 why? I find it very confusing. *)

  100. let matching_instructions instr =
  101.   let all = all_matching_instructions instr in
  102. ‌  let prio = List.filter (fun i -> i.instr_prio) all in
  103.   if prio = [] then all else prio

  105. ‌let matching_variables =
  106.   matching_elements variable_list (fun v -> v.var_name)

  108. let matching_infos =
  109.   matching_elements info_list (fun i -> i.info_name)

  111. let find_ident name matcher action alternative ppf lexbuf =
  112.   match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  113.   | None -> alternative ppf
  114.   | Some ident ->
  115.       match matcher ident with
  116.       | [] -> error ("Unknown " ^ name ^ ".")
  117.       | [a] -> action a ppf lexbuf
  118.       | _ -> error ("Ambiguous " ^ name ^ ".")

  120. ‌let find_variable action alternative ppf lexbuf =
  121.   find_ident "variable name" matching_variables action alternative ppf lexbuf

  123. ‌let find_info action alternative ppf lexbuf =
  124.   find_ident "info command" matching_infos action alternative ppf lexbuf

  126. ‌let add_breakpoint_at_pc pc =
  127.   try
  128.     new_breakpoint (any_event_at_pc pc)
  129.   with
  130.   | Not_found ->
  131.     eprintf "Can\'t add breakpoint at pc %i:%i: no event there.@."
  132.             pc.frag pc.pos;
  133.     raise Toplevel

  135. ‌let add_breakpoint_after_pc pc =
  136.   let rec try_add n =
  137.     if n < 3 then begin
  138.       try
  139.         new_breakpoint (any_event_at_pc {pc with pos = pc.pos + n * 4})
  140.       with
  141.       | Not_found ->
  142.         try_add (n+1)
  143.     end else begin
  144.       error
  145.         "Can\'t add breakpoint at beginning of function: no event there"
  146.     end
  147.   in try_add 0

  149. ‌let module_of_longident id =
  150.   match id with
  151.   | Some x -> Some (String.concat "." (Longident.flatten x))
  152.   | None -> None

  154. ‌let convert_module mdle =
  155.   match mdle with
  156.   | Some m ->
  157.       (* Strip .ml extension if any, and capitalize *)
  158.       String.capitalize_ascii(if Filename.check_suffix m ".ml"
  159.                               then Filename.chop_suffix m ".ml"
  160.                               else m)
  161.   | None ->
  162.       try (get_current_event ()).ev_ev.ev_module
  163.       with Not_found -> error "Not in a module."

  165. (** Toplevel. **)
  166. ‌let current_line = ref ""

  168. ‌let interprete_line ppf line =
  169.   current_line := line;
  170.   let lexbuf = Lexing.from_string line in
  171.     try
  172.       match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  173.       | Some x ->
  174.           begin match matching_instructions x with
  175.           | [] ->
  176.               error "Unknown command."
  177.           | [i] ->
  178.               i.instr_action ppf lexbuf;
  179.               resume_user_input ();
  180.               i.instr_repeat
  181.           | _ ->
  182.               error "Ambiguous command."
  183.           end
  184.       | None ->
  185.           resume_user_input ();
  186.           false
  187.     with
  188.     | Parsing.Parse_error ->
  189.         error "Syntax error."
  190.     | Lexer.Int_overflow ->
  191.       error "Integer overflow"

  193. ‌let line_loop ppf line_buffer =
  194.   resume_user_input ();
  195.   let previous_line = ref "" in
  196.     try
  197.       while true do
  198.         if !loaded then
  199.           History.add_current_time ();
  200.         let new_line = string_trim (line line_buffer) in
  201.           let line =
  202.             if new_line <> "" then
  203.               new_line
  204.             else
  205.               !previous_line
  206.           in
  207.             previous_line := "";
  208.             if interprete_line ppf line && !interactif then
  209.               previous_line := line
  210.       done
  211.     with
  212.     | Exit ->
  213.         ()
  214. (*    | Sys_error s ->
  215.         error ("System error: " ^ s) *)

  217. (** Instructions. **)
  218. ‌let instr_cd _ppf lexbuf =
  219.   let dir = argument_eol argument lexbuf in
  220.     if ask_kill_program () then
  221.       try
  222.         Sys.chdir (expand_path dir)
  223.       with
  224.       | Sys_error s ->
  225.           error s

  227. ‌let instr_shell _ppf lexbuf =
  228.   let cmdarg = argument_list_eol argument lexbuf in
  229.   let cmd = String.concat " " cmdarg in
  230.   (* perhaps we should use $SHELL -c ? *)
  231.   let err = Sys.command cmd in
  232.   if (err != 0) then
  233.     eprintf "Shell command %S failed with exit code %d\n%!" cmd err

  235. ‌let instr_env _ppf lexbuf =
  236.   let cmdarg = argument_list_eol argument lexbuf in
  237.   let cmdarg = string_trim (String.concat " " cmdarg) in
  238.   if cmdarg <> "" then
  239.     if ask_kill_program () then begin
  240.       try
  241.         let eqpos = String.index cmdarg '=' in
  242.         if eqpos = 0 then raise Not_found;
  243.         let name = String.sub cmdarg 0 eqpos in
  244.         let value =
  245.           String.sub cmdarg (eqpos + 1) (String.length cmdarg - eqpos - 1)
  246.         in
  247.         Debugger_config.environment :=
  248.           (name, value) :: List.remove_assoc name !Debugger_config.environment
  249.       with Not_found ->
  250.         eprintf "Environment variable must be in name=value format\n%!"
  251.     end
  252.   else
  253.     List.iter
  254.       (fun (vvar, vval) -> printf "%s=%s\n%!" vvar vval)
  255.       (List.rev !Debugger_config.environment)

  257. ‌let instr_pwd ppf lexbuf =
  258.   eol lexbuf;
  259.   fprintf ppf "%s@." (Sys.getcwd ())

  261. ‌let instr_dir ppf lexbuf =
  262.   let new_directory = argument_list_eol argument lexbuf in
  263.     if new_directory = [] then begin
  264.       if yes_or_no "Reinitialize directory list" then begin
  265.         Load_path.init ~auto_include:Compmisc.auto_include !default_load_path;
  266.         Envaux.reset_cache ();
  267.         Hashtbl.clear Debugger_config.load_path_for;
  268.         flush_buffer_list ()
  269.         end
  270.       end
  271.     else begin
  272. ‌      let new_directory' = List.rev new_directory in
  273.       match new_directory' with
  274.       | mdl :: for_keyw :: tl
  275.         when String.lowercase_ascii for_keyw = "for" && List.length tl > 0 ->
  276.           List.iter (function x -> add_path_for mdl (expand_path x)) tl
  277.       | _ ->
  278.           List.iter (function x -> add_path (expand_path x)) new_directory'
  279.     end;
  280. ‌    let print_dirs ppf l = List.iter (function x -> fprintf ppf "@ %s" x) l in
  281.     fprintf ppf "@[<2>Directories: %a@]@." print_dirs (Load_path.get_paths ());
  282.     Hashtbl.iter
  283.       (fun mdl dirs ->
  284.          fprintf ppf "@[<2>Source directories for %s: %a@]@." mdl print_dirs
  285.                  dirs)
  286.       Debugger_config.load_path_for

  288. ‌let instr_kill _ppf lexbuf =
  289.   eol lexbuf;
  290.   if not !loaded then error "The program is not being run.";
  291.   if (yes_or_no "Kill the program being debugged") then begin
  292.     kill_program ();
  293.     show_no_point()
  294.   end

  296. let instr_pid ppf lexbuf =
  297.   eol lexbuf;
  298.   if not !loaded then error "The program is not being run.";
  299.   fprintf ppf "@[%d@]@." !current_checkpoint.c_pid

  301. ‌let instr_run ppf lexbuf =
  302.   eol lexbuf;
  303.   ensure_loaded ();
  304.   reset_named_values ();
  305.   run ();
  306.   show_current_event ppf

  308. ‌let instr_reverse ppf lexbuf =
  309.   eol lexbuf;
  310.   check_not_windows "reverse";
  311.   ensure_loaded ();
  312.   reset_named_values();
  313.   back_run ();
  314.   show_current_event ppf

  316. ‌let instr_step ppf lexbuf =
  317.   let step_count =
  318.     match opt_signed_int64_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  319.     | None -> _1
  320.     | Some x -> x
  321.   in
  322.     ensure_loaded ();
  323.     reset_named_values();
  324.     step step_count;
  325.     show_current_event ppf

  327. ‌let instr_back ppf lexbuf =
  328.   let step_count =
  329.     match opt_signed_int64_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  330.     | None -> _1
  331.     | Some x -> x
  332.   in
  333.     check_not_windows "backstep";
  334.     ensure_loaded ();
  335.     reset_named_values();
  336.     step (_0 -- step_count);
  337.     show_current_event ppf

  339. ‌let instr_finish ppf lexbuf =
  340.   eol lexbuf;
  341.   ensure_loaded ();
  342.   reset_named_values();
  343.   finish ();
  344.   show_current_event ppf

  346. ‌let instr_next ppf lexbuf =
  347.   let step_count =
  348.     match opt_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  349.     | None -> 1
  350.     | Some x -> x
  351.   in
  352.     ensure_loaded ();
  353.     reset_named_values();
  354.     next step_count;
  355.     show_current_event ppf

  357. ‌let instr_start ppf lexbuf =
  358.   eol lexbuf;
  359.   check_not_windows "start";
  360.   ensure_loaded ();
  361.   reset_named_values();
  362.   start ();
  363.   show_current_event ppf

  365. ‌let instr_previous ppf lexbuf =
  366.   let step_count =
  367.     match opt_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  368.     | None -> 1
  369.     | Some x -> x
  370.   in
  371.     check_not_windows "previous";
  372.     ensure_loaded ();
  373.     reset_named_values();
  374.     previous step_count;
  375.     show_current_event ppf

  377. ‌let instr_goto ppf lexbuf =
  378.   let time = int64_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  379.     ensure_loaded ();
  380.     reset_named_values();
  381.     go_to time;
  382.     show_current_event ppf

  384. ‌let instr_quit _ =
  385.   raise Exit

  387. ‌let print_variable_list ppf =
  388.   let pr_vars ppf = List.iter (fun v -> fprintf ppf "%s@ " v.var_name) in
  389.   fprintf ppf "List of variables: %a@." pr_vars !variable_list

  391. ‌let print_info_list ppf =
  392.   let pr_infos ppf = List.iter (fun i -> fprintf ppf "%s@ " i.info_name)  in
  393.   fprintf ppf "List of info commands: %a@." pr_infos !info_list

  395. ‌let instr_complete _ppf lexbuf =
  396.   let ppf = Format.err_formatter in
  397.   let rec print_list l =
  398.     try
  399.       eol lexbuf;
  400.       List.iter (function i -> fprintf ppf "%s@." i) l
  401.     with _ ->
  402.       remove_file !user_channel
  403.   and match_list lexbuf =
  404.     match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  405.     | None ->
  406.         List.map (fun i -> i.instr_name) !instruction_list
  407.     | Some x ->
  408.         match matching_instructions x with
  409.         | [ {instr_name = ("set" | "show" as i_full)} ] ->
  410.             if x = i_full then begin
  411.               match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  412.               | Some ident ->
  413.                   begin match matching_variables ident with
  414.                   | [v] -> if v.var_name = ident then [] else [v.var_name]
  415.                   | l   -> List.map (fun v -> v.var_name) l
  416.                   end
  417.               | None ->
  418.                   List.map (fun v -> v.var_name) !variable_list
  419.             end
  420.             else [i_full]
  421.         | [ {instr_name = "info"} ] ->
  422.             if x = "info" then begin
  423.               match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  424.               | Some ident ->
  425.                   begin match matching_infos ident with
  426.                   | [i] -> if i.info_name = ident then [] else [i.info_name]
  427.                   | l   -> List.map (fun i -> i.info_name) l
  428.                   end
  429.               | None ->
  430.                   List.map (fun i -> i.info_name) !info_list
  431.             end
  432.             else ["info"]
  433.         | [ {instr_name = "help"} ] ->
  434.             if x = "help" then match_list lexbuf else ["help"]
  435.         | [ i ] ->
  436.             if x = i.instr_name then [] else [i.instr_name]
  437.         | l ->
  438.             List.map (fun i -> i.instr_name) l
  439.   in
  440.     print_list(match_list lexbuf)

  442. ‌let instr_help ppf lexbuf =
  443.   let pr_instrs ppf =
  444.       List.iter (fun i -> fprintf ppf "%s@ " i.instr_name) in
  445.   match identifier_or_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  446.   | Some x ->
  447.       let print_help nm hlp =
  448.         eol lexbuf;
  449.         fprintf ppf "%s: %s@." nm hlp in
  450.       begin match matching_instructions x with
  451.       | [] ->
  452.           eol lexbuf;
  453.           fprintf ppf "No matching command.@."
  454.       | [ {instr_name = "set"} ] ->
  455.           find_variable
  456.             (fun v _ _ ->
  457.                print_help ("set " ^ v.var_name) ("set " ^ v.var_help))
  458.             (fun ppf ->
  459.                print_help "set" "set debugger variable.";
  460.                print_variable_list ppf)
  461.             ppf
  462.             lexbuf
  463.       | [ {instr_name = "show"} ] ->
  464.           find_variable
  465.             (fun v _ _ ->
  466.                print_help ("show " ^ v.var_name) ("show " ^ v.var_help))
  467.             (fun _v ->
  468.                print_help "show" "display debugger variable.";
  469.                print_variable_list ppf)
  470.             ppf
  471.             lexbuf
  472.       | [ {instr_name = "info"} ] ->
  473.           find_info
  474.             (fun i _ _ -> print_help ("info " ^ i.info_name) i.info_help)
  475.             (fun ppf ->
  476.                print_help "info"
  477.                  "display infos about the program being debugged.";
  478.                print_info_list ppf)
  479.             ppf
  480.             lexbuf
  481.       | [i] ->
  482.           print_help i.instr_name i.instr_help
  483.       | l ->
  484.           eol lexbuf;
  485.           fprintf ppf "Ambiguous command \"%s\": %a@." x pr_instrs l
  486.       end
  487.   | None ->
  488.       fprintf ppf "List of commands: %a@." pr_instrs !instruction_list

  490. (* Printing values *)

  492. ‌let print_expr depth ev env ppf expr =
  493.   try
  494.     let (v, ty) = Eval.expression ev env expr in
  495.     print_named_value depth expr env v ppf ty
  496.   with
  497.   | Eval.Error msg ->
  498.     Eval.report_error ppf msg;
  499.     raise Toplevel

  501. ‌let env_of_event =
  502.   function
  503.     None    -> Env.empty
  504.   | Some ev ->
  505.       Envaux.env_from_summary ev.ev_ev.ev_typenv ev.ev_ev.ev_typsubst

  507. ‌let print_command depth ppf lexbuf =
  508.   let exprs = expression_list_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  509.   ensure_loaded ();
  510.   let env =
  511.     try
  512.       env_of_event !selected_event
  513.     with
  514.     | Envaux.Error msg ->
  515.         Envaux.report_error ppf msg;
  516.         raise Toplevel
  517.   in
  518.   List.iter (print_expr depth !selected_event env ppf) exprs

  520. ‌let instr_print ppf lexbuf = print_command !max_printer_depth ppf lexbuf

  522. ‌let instr_display ppf lexbuf = print_command 1 ppf lexbuf

  524. ‌let instr_address ppf lexbuf =
  525.   let exprs = expression_list_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  526.   ensure_loaded ();
  527.   let env =
  528.     try
  529.       env_of_event !selected_event
  530.     with
  531.     | Envaux.Error msg ->
  532.         Envaux.report_error ppf msg;
  533.         raise Toplevel
  534.   in
  535.   let print_addr expr =
  536.     let (v, _ty) =
  537.       try Eval.expression !selected_event env expr
  538.       with Eval.Error msg ->
  539.         Eval.report_error ppf msg;
  540.         raise Toplevel
  541.     in
  542.     match Remote_value.pointer v with
  543.     | "" -> fprintf ppf "[not a remote value]@."
  544.     | s -> fprintf ppf "0x%s@." s
  545.   in
  546.   List.iter print_addr exprs

  548. (* Loading of command files *)

  550. ‌let extract_filename arg =
  551.   (* Allow enclosing filename in quotes *)
  552.   let l = String.length arg in
  553.   let pos1 = if l > 0 && arg.[0] = '\"' then 1 else 0 in
  554. ‌  let pos2 = if l > 0 && arg.[l-1] = '\"' then l-1 else l in
  555.   String.sub arg pos1 (pos2 - pos1)

  557. ‌let instr_source ppf lexbuf =
  558.   let file = extract_filename(argument_eol argument lexbuf)
  559.   and old_state = !interactif
  560.   and old_channel = !user_channel in
  561.     let io_chan =
  562.       try
  563.         io_channel_of_descr
  564.           (openfile (Load_path.find (expand_path file))
  565.              [O_RDONLY] 0)
  566.       with
  567.       | Not_found -> error "Source file not found."
  568.       | (Unix_error _) as x  -> Unix_tools.report_error x; raise Toplevel
  569.     in
  570.       interactif := false;
  571.       user_channel := io_chan;
  572.       let loop () =
  573.         line_loop ppf (Lexing.from_function read_user_input)
  574.       and finally () =
  575.         stop_user_input ();
  576.         close_io io_chan;
  577.         interactif := old_state;
  578.         user_channel := old_channel
  579.       in
  580.       Fun.protect ~finally loop

  582. ‌let instr_set =
  583.   find_variable
  584.     (fun {var_action = (funct, _)} _ppf lexbuf -> funct lexbuf)
  585.     (function _ppf -> error "Argument required.")

  587. let instr_show =
  588.   find_variable
  589.     (fun {var_action = (_, funct)} ppf lexbuf -> eol lexbuf; funct ppf)
  590.     (function ppf ->
  591.        List.iter
  592.          (function {var_name = nm; var_action = (_, funct)} ->
  593.               fprintf ppf "%s: " nm;
  594.               funct ppf)
  595.          !variable_list)

  597. let instr_info =
  598.   find_info
  599.     (fun i _ppf lexbuf -> i.info_action lexbuf)
  600.     (function _ppf ->
  601.        error "\"info\" must be followed by the name of an info command.")

  603. let instr_break ppf lexbuf =
  604.   let argument = break_argument_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  605.     ensure_loaded ();
  606.     match argument with
  607.     |  BA_none ->                                (* break *)
  608.         (match !selected_event with
  609.          | Some ev ->
  610.              new_breakpoint ev
  611.          | None ->
  612.              error "Can\'t add breakpoint at this point.")
  613.     | BA_pc {frag; pos} ->                      (* break PC *)
  614.         add_breakpoint_at_pc {frag; pos}
  615.     | BA_function expr ->                       (* break FUNCTION *)
  616. ‌        let env =
  617.           try
  618.             env_of_event !selected_event
  619.           with
  620.           | Envaux.Error msg ->
  621.               Envaux.report_error ppf msg;
  622.               raise Toplevel
  623.         in
  624.         begin try
  625. ‌          let (v, ty) = Eval.expression !selected_event env expr in
  626.           match get_desc ty with
  627.           | Tarrow _ ->
  628.               add_breakpoint_after_pc (Remote_value.closure_code v)
  629.           | _ ->
  630.               eprintf "Not a function.@.";
  631.               raise Toplevel
  632.         with
  633.         | Eval.Error msg ->
  634.             Eval.report_error ppf msg;
  635.             raise Toplevel
  636.         end
  637.     | BA_pos1 (mdle, line, column) ->         (* break @ [MODULE] LINE [COL] *)
  638. ‌        let module_name = convert_module (module_of_longident mdle) in
  639.         new_breakpoint
  640.           (try
  641. ‌            let ev =  event_at_pos module_name 0 in
  642. ‌            let ev_pos =
  643.               {Lexing.dummy_pos with
  644.                pos_fname = (Events.get_pos ev.ev_ev).pos_fname} in
  645. ‌             let buffer =
  646.                try get_buffer ev_pos module_name with
  647.                | Not_found ->
  648.                   eprintf "No source file for %s.@." module_name;
  649.                   raise Toplevel
  650.              in
  651.              match column with
  652.              | None ->
  653.                  event_at_pos module_name (fst (pos_of_line buffer line))
  654.              | Some col ->
  655.                  event_near_pos module_name (point_of_coord buffer line col)
  656.            with
  657.            | Not_found -> (* event_at_pos / event_near pos *)
  658.                eprintf "Can\'t find any event there.@.";
  659.                raise Toplevel
  660.            | Out_of_range -> (* pos_of_line / point_of_coord *)
  661.                eprintf "Position out of range.@.";
  662.                raise Toplevel)
  663.     | BA_pos2 (mdle, position) ->             (* break @ [MODULE] # POSITION *)
  664.         try
  665.           new_breakpoint
  666.             (event_near_pos (convert_module (module_of_longident mdle))
  667.                             position)
  668.         with
  669.         | Not_found ->
  670.             eprintf "Can\'t find any event there.@."

  672. ‌let instr_delete _ppf lexbuf =
  673.   match integer_list_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  674.   | [] ->
  675.       if breakpoints_count () <> 0 && yes_or_no "Delete all breakpoints"
  676.       then remove_all_breakpoints ()
  677.   | breakpoints ->
  678.       List.iter
  679.         (function x -> try remove_breakpoint x with | Not_found -> ())
  680.         breakpoints

  682. let instr_frame ppf lexbuf =
  683.   let frame_number =
  684.     match opt_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  685.     | None -> !current_frame
  686.     | Some x -> x
  687.   in
  688.     ensure_loaded ();
  689.     try
  690.       select_frame frame_number;
  691.       show_current_frame ppf true
  692.     with
  693.     | Not_found ->
  694.         error ("No frame number " ^ Int.to_string frame_number ^ ".")

  696. ‌let instr_backtrace ppf lexbuf =
  697.   let number =
  698.     match opt_signed_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  699.     | None -> 0
  700.     | Some x -> x in
  701.   ensure_loaded ();
  702.   match current_report() with
  703.   | None | Some {rep_type = Exited | Uncaught_exc | Code_loaded _} -> ()
  704.   | Some _ ->
  705.       let frame_counter = ref 0 in
  706.       let print_frame first_frame last_frame = function
  707.       | None ->
  708.           fprintf ppf
  709.            "(Encountered a function with no debugging information)@.";
  710.           false
  711.       | Some event ->
  712.           if !frame_counter >= first_frame then
  713.             show_one_frame !frame_counter ppf event;
  714.           incr frame_counter;
  715.           if !frame_counter >= last_frame then begin
  716.             fprintf ppf "(More frames follow)@."
  717.           end;
  718.           !frame_counter < last_frame in
  719.       fprintf ppf "Backtrace:@.";
  720.       if number = 0 then
  721.         do_backtrace (print_frame 0 max_int)
  722.       else if number > 0 then
  723.         do_backtrace (print_frame 0 number)
  724.       else begin
  725.         let num_frames = stack_depth() in
  726.         if num_frames < 0 then
  727.           fprintf ppf
  728.             "(Encountered a function with no debugging information)@."
  729.         else
  730.           do_backtrace (print_frame (num_frames + number) max_int)
  731.       end

  733. ‌let instr_up ppf lexbuf =
  734.   let offset =
  735.     match opt_signed_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  736.     | None -> 1
  737.     | Some x -> x
  738.   in
  739.     ensure_loaded ();
  740.     try
  741.       select_frame (!current_frame + offset);
  742.       show_current_frame ppf true
  743.     with
  744.     | Not_found -> error "No such frame."

  746. ‌let instr_down ppf lexbuf =
  747.   let offset =
  748.     match opt_signed_integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  749.     | None -> 1
  750.     | Some x -> x
  751.   in
  752.     ensure_loaded ();
  753.     try
  754.       select_frame (!current_frame - offset);
  755.       show_current_frame ppf true
  756.     with
  757.     | Not_found -> error "No such frame."

  759. ‌let instr_last ppf lexbuf =
  760.   let count =
  761.     match opt_signed_int64_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  762.     | None -> _1
  763.     | Some x -> x
  764.   in
  765.     check_not_windows "last";
  766.     reset_named_values();
  767.     go_to (History.previous_time count);
  768.     show_current_event ppf

  770. ‌let instr_list _ppf lexbuf =
  771.   let (mo, beg, e) = list_arguments_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  772.     let (curr_mod, line, column) =
  773.       try
  774.         selected_point ()
  775.       with
  776.       | Not_found ->
  777.           ("", -1, -1)
  778.     in
  779.       let mdle =
  780.         match mo with
  781.         | None -> curr_mod
  782.         | _ -> convert_module (module_of_longident mo)
  783.       in
  784.       let pos = Lexing.dummy_pos in
  785.       let buffer =
  786.         try get_buffer pos mdle with
  787.         | Not_found -> error ("No source file for " ^ mdle ^ ".") in
  788.       let point =
  789.         if column <> -1 then
  790.           try
  791.             (point_of_coord buffer line 1) + column
  792.           with Out_of_range ->
  793.             -1
  794.         else
  795.           -1 in
  796. ‌        let beginning =
  797.           match beg with
  798.           | None when (mo <> None) || (line = -1) ->
  799.               1
  800.           | None ->
  801.               begin try
  802.                 Int.max 1 (line - 10)
  803.               with Out_of_range ->
  804.                 1
  805.               end
  806.           | Some x -> x
  807.         in
  808. ‌          let en =
  809.             match e with
  810.             | None -> beginning + 20
  811.             | Some x -> x
  812.           in
  813.             if mdle = curr_mod then
  814.               show_listing pos mdle beginning en point
  815.                 (current_event_is_before ())
  816.             else
  817.               show_listing pos mdle beginning en (-1) true

  819. (** Variables. **)
  820. ‌let raw_variable kill name =
  821.   (function lexbuf ->
  822.      let argument = argument_eol argument lexbuf in
  823.        if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then name := argument),
  824.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%s@." !name

  826. ‌let raw_line_variable kill name =
  827.   (function lexbuf ->
  828.      let argument = argument_eol line_argument lexbuf in
  829.        if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then name := argument),
  830.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%s@." !name

  832. ‌let integer_variable kill min msg name =
  833.   (function lexbuf ->
  834.      let argument = integer_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  835.        if argument < min then print_endline msg
  836.        else if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then name := argument),
  837.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%i@." !name

  839. ‌let int64_variable kill min msg name =
  840.   (function lexbuf ->
  841.      let argument = int64_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  842.        if argument < min then print_endline msg
  843.        else if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then name := argument),
  844.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%Li@." !name

  846. ‌let boolean_variable kill name =
  847.   (function lexbuf ->
  848.      let argument =
  849.        match identifier_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  850.        | "on" -> true
  851.        | "of" | "off" -> false
  852.        | _ -> error "Syntax error."
  853.      in
  854.        if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then name := argument),
  855.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%s@." (if !name then "on" else "off")

  857. ‌let path_variable kill name =
  858.   (function lexbuf ->
  859.        let argument = argument_eol argument lexbuf in
  860.          if (not kill) || ask_kill_program () then
  861.            name := make_absolute (expand_path argument)),
  862.   function ppf -> fprintf ppf "%s@." !name

  864. ‌let loading_mode_variable ppf =
  865.   (find_ident
  866.      "loading mode"
  867.      (matching_elements (ref loading_modes) fst)
  868.      (fun (_, mode) _ppf lexbuf ->
  869.         eol lexbuf; set_launching_function mode)
  870.      (function _ppf -> error "Syntax error.")
  871.      ppf),
  872.   function ppf ->
  873.     let rec find = function
  874.       | [] -> ()
  875.       | (name, funct) :: l ->
  876.           if funct == !launching_func then fprintf ppf "%s" name else find l
  877.     in
  878.       find loading_modes;
  879.       fprintf ppf "@."

  881. ‌let follow_fork_variable =
  882.   (function lexbuf ->
  883.      let mode =
  884.        match identifier_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf with
  885.        | "child" -> Fork_child
  886.        | "parent" -> Fork_parent
  887.        | _ -> error "Syntax error."
  888.      in
  889.        fork_mode := mode;
  890.        if !loaded then update_follow_fork_mode ()),
  891.   function ppf ->
  892.     fprintf ppf "%s@."
  893.       (match !fork_mode with
  894.          Fork_child -> "child"
  895.        | Fork_parent -> "parent")

  897. (** Infos. **)

  899. let pr_modules ppf mods =
  900. let pr_mods ppf = List.iter (function x -> fprintf ppf "%s@ " x) in
  901. fprintf ppf "Used modules: @.%a@?" pr_mods mods

  903. ‌let info_modules ppf lexbuf =
  904.   eol lexbuf;
  905.   ensure_loaded ();
  906.   pr_modules ppf !modules
  907. (********
  908.   print_endline "Opened modules: ";
  909.   if !opened_modules_names = [] then
  910.     print_endline "(no module opened)."
  911.   else
  912.     (List.iter (function x -> print_string x;print_space) !opened_modules_names;
  913.      print_newline ())
  914. *********)

  916. ‌let info_checkpoints ppf lexbuf =
  917.   eol lexbuf;
  918.   if !checkpoints = [] then fprintf ppf "No checkpoint.@."
  919.   else
  920.     (if !debug_breakpoints then
  921.        (prerr_endline "               Time   Pid Version";
  922.         List.iter
  923.           (function
  924.              {c_time = time; c_pid = pid; c_breakpoint_version = version} ->
  925.                Printf.printf "%19Ld %5d %d\n" time pid version)
  926.           !checkpoints)
  927.      else
  928.        (print_endline "               Time   Pid";
  929.         List.iter
  930.           (function
  931.              {c_time = time; c_pid = pid} ->
  932.                Printf.printf "%19Ld %5d\n" time pid)
  933.           !checkpoints))

  935. let info_one_breakpoint ppf (num, ev) =
  936.   fprintf ppf "%3d %d:%10d  %s@." num ev.ev_frag ev.ev_ev.ev_pos
  937.           (Pos.get_desc ev)

  939. let info_breakpoints ppf lexbuf =
  940.   eol lexbuf;
  941.   if !breakpoints = [] then fprintf ppf "No breakpoints.@."
  942.   else begin
  943.     fprintf ppf "Num    Address  Where@.";
  944.     List.iter (info_one_breakpoint ppf) (List.rev !breakpoints);
  945.   end


  948. let info_events _ppf lexbuf =
  949.   ensure_loaded ();
  950.   let mdle =
  951.     convert_module (module_of_longident (opt_longident_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf))
  952.   in
  953.     print_endline ("Module: " ^ mdle);
  954.     print_endline "   Address  Characters        Kind      Repr.";
  955. ‌    let frag, events = events_in_module mdle in
  956.     List.iter
  957.       (function ev ->
  958. ‌        let start_char, end_char =
  959.           try
  960.             let buffer = get_buffer (Events.get_pos ev) ev.ev_module in
  961.             (snd (start_and_cnum buffer ev.ev_loc.Location.loc_start)),
  962.             (snd (start_and_cnum buffer ev.ev_loc.Location.loc_end))
  963.           with _ ->
  964.             ev.ev_loc.Location.loc_start.Lexing.pos_cnum,
  965.             ev.ev_loc.Location.loc_end.Lexing.pos_cnum in
  966.         Printf.printf
  967.            "%d:%10d %6d-%-6d  %10s %10s\n"
  968.            frag
  969.            ev.ev_pos
  970.            start_char
  971.            end_char
  972.            ((match ev.ev_kind with
  973.                Event_before   -> "before"
  974.              | Event_after _  -> "after"
  975.              | Event_pseudo   -> "pseudo")
  976.             ^
  977.             (match ev.ev_info with
  978.                Event_function -> "/fun"
  979.              | Event_return _ -> "/ret"
  980.              | Event_other    -> ""))
  981.            (match ev.ev_repr with
  982.               Event_none        -> ""
  983.             | Event_parent _    -> "(repr)"
  984.             | Event_child repr  -> Int.to_string !repr))
  985.       events

  987. (** User-defined printers **)

  989. ‌let instr_load_printer ppf lexbuf =
  990.   let filename = extract_filename(argument_eol argument lexbuf) in
  991.   try
  992.     Loadprinter.loadfile ppf filename
  993.   with Loadprinter.Error e ->
  994.     Loadprinter.report_error ppf e; raise Toplevel

  996. ‌let instr_install_printer ppf lexbuf =
  997.   let lid = longident_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  998.   try
  999.     Loadprinter.install_printer ppf lid
  1000.   with Loadprinter.Error e ->
  1001.     Loadprinter.report_error ppf e; raise Toplevel

  1003. ‌let instr_remove_printer ppf lexbuf =
  1004.   let lid = longident_eol Lexer.lexeme lexbuf in
  1005.   try
  1006.     Loadprinter.remove_printer lid
  1007.   with Loadprinter.Error e ->
  1008.     Loadprinter.report_error ppf e; raise Toplevel

  1010. (** Initialization. **)
  1011. ‌let init ppf =
  1012.   instruction_list := [
  1013.      { instr_name = "cd"; instr_prio = false;
  1014.        instr_action = instr_cd; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1015. "set working directory to DIR for debugger and program being debugged." };
  1016.      { instr_name = "complete"; instr_prio = false;
  1017.        instr_action = instr_complete; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1018. "complete word at cursor according to context. Useful for Emacs." };
  1019.      { instr_name = "pwd"; instr_prio = false;
  1020.        instr_action = instr_pwd; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1021. "print working directory." };
  1022.      { instr_name = "directory"; instr_prio = false;
  1023.        instr_action = instr_dir; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1024. "add directory DIR to beginning of search path for source and\n\
  1025. interface files.\n\
  1026. Forget cached info on source file locations and line positions.\n\
  1027. With no argument, reset the search path." };
  1028.      { instr_name = "kill"; instr_prio = false;
  1029.        instr_action = instr_kill; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1030. "kill the program being debugged." };
  1031.      { instr_name = "pid"; instr_prio = false;
  1032.        instr_action = instr_pid; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1033. "print the process ID of the current active process." };
  1034.      { instr_name = "address"; instr_prio = false;
  1035.        instr_action = instr_address; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1036. "print the raw address of a value." };
  1037.      { instr_name = "help"; instr_prio = false;
  1038.        instr_action = instr_help; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1039. "print list of commands." };
  1040.      { instr_name = "quit"; instr_prio = false;
  1041.        instr_action = instr_quit; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1042. "exit the debugger." };
  1043.      { instr_name = "shell"; instr_prio = false;
  1044.        instr_action = instr_shell; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1045. "Execute a given COMMAND through the system shell." };
  1046.      { instr_name = "environment"; instr_prio = false;
  1047.        instr_action = instr_env; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1048. "environment variable to give to program being debugged when it is started." };
  1049.       (* Displacements *)
  1050.      { instr_name = "run"; instr_prio = true;
  1051.        instr_action = instr_run; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1052. "run the program from current position." };
  1053.      { instr_name = "reverse"; instr_prio = false;
  1054.        instr_action = instr_reverse; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1055. "run the program backward from current position." };
  1056.      { instr_name = "step"; instr_prio = true;
  1057.        instr_action = instr_step; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1058. "step program until it reaches the next event.\n\
  1059. Argument N means do this N times (or till program stops for another reason)." };
  1060.      { instr_name = "backstep"; instr_prio = true;
  1061.        instr_action = instr_back; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1062. "step program backward until it reaches the previous event.\n\
  1063. Argument N means do this N times (or till program stops for another reason)." };
  1064.      { instr_name = "goto"; instr_prio = false;
  1065.        instr_action = instr_goto; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1066. "go to the given time." };
  1067.      { instr_name = "finish"; instr_prio = true;
  1068.        instr_action = instr_finish; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1069. "execute until topmost stack frame returns." };
  1070.      { instr_name = "next"; instr_prio = true;
  1071.        instr_action = instr_next; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1072. "step program until it reaches the next event.\n\
  1073. Skip over function calls.\n\
  1074. Argument N means do this N times (or till program stops for another reason)." };
  1075.      { instr_name = "start"; instr_prio = false;
  1076.        instr_action = instr_start; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1077. "execute backward until the current function is exited." };
  1078.      { instr_name = "previous"; instr_prio = false;
  1079.        instr_action = instr_previous; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1080. "step program until it reaches the previous event.\n\
  1081. Skip over function calls.\n\
  1082. Argument N means do this N times (or till program stops for another reason)." };
  1083.      { instr_name = "print"; instr_prio = true;
  1084.        instr_action = instr_print; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1085. "print value of expressions (deep printing)." };
  1086.      { instr_name = "display"; instr_prio = true;
  1087.        instr_action = instr_display; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1088. "print value of expressions (shallow printing)." };
  1089.      { instr_name = "source"; instr_prio = false;
  1090.        instr_action = instr_source; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1091. "read command from file FILE." };
  1092.      (* Breakpoints *)
  1093.      { instr_name = "break"; instr_prio = false;
  1094.        instr_action = instr_break; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1095. "Set breakpoint.\
  1096. \nSyntax: break\
  1097. \n        break function-name\
  1098. \n        break @ [module] linenum\
  1099. \n        break @ [module] linenum columnnum\
  1100. \n        break @ [module] # characternum\
  1101. \n        break frag:pc\
  1102. \n        break pc" };
  1103.      { instr_name = "delete"; instr_prio = false;
  1104.        instr_action = instr_delete; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1105. "delete some breakpoints.\n\
  1106. Arguments are breakpoint numbers with spaces in between.\n\
  1107. To delete all breakpoints, give no argument." };
  1108.      { instr_name = "set"; instr_prio = false;
  1109.        instr_action = instr_set; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1110. "--unused--" };
  1111.      { instr_name = "show"; instr_prio = false;
  1112.        instr_action = instr_show; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1113. "--unused--" };
  1114.      { instr_name = "info"; instr_prio = false;
  1115.        instr_action = instr_info; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1116. "--unused--" };
  1117.      (* Frames *)
  1118.      { instr_name = "frame"; instr_prio = false;
  1119.        instr_action = instr_frame; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1120. "select and print a stack frame.\n\
  1121. With no argument, print the selected stack frame.\n\
  1122. An argument specifies the frame to select." };
  1123.      { instr_name = "backtrace"; instr_prio = false;
  1124.        instr_action = instr_backtrace; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1125. "print backtrace of all stack frames, or innermost COUNT frames.\n\
  1126. With a negative argument, print outermost -COUNT frames." };
  1127.      { instr_name = "bt"; instr_prio = false;
  1128.        instr_action = instr_backtrace; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1129. "print backtrace of all stack frames, or innermost COUNT frames.\n\
  1130. With a negative argument, print outermost -COUNT frames." };
  1131.      { instr_name = "up"; instr_prio = false;
  1132.        instr_action = instr_up; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1133. "select and print stack frame that called this one.\n\
  1134. An argument says how many frames up to go." };
  1135.      { instr_name = "down"; instr_prio = false;
  1136.        instr_action = instr_down; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1137. "select and print stack frame called by this one.\n\
  1138. An argument says how many frames down to go." };
  1139.      { instr_name = "last"; instr_prio = true;
  1140.        instr_action = instr_last; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1141. "go back to previous time." };
  1142.      { instr_name = "list"; instr_prio = false;
  1143.        instr_action = instr_list; instr_repeat = true; instr_help =
  1144. "list the source code." };
  1145.      (* User-defined printers *)
  1146.      { instr_name = "load_printer"; instr_prio = false;
  1147.        instr_action = instr_load_printer; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1148. "load in the debugger a .cmo or .cma file containing printing functions." };
  1149.      { instr_name = "install_printer"; instr_prio = false;
  1150.        instr_action = instr_install_printer; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1151. "use the given function for printing values of its input type.\n\
  1152. The code for the function must have previously been loaded in the debugger\n\
  1153. using \"load_printer\"." };
  1154.      { instr_name = "remove_printer"; instr_prio = false;
  1155.        instr_action = instr_remove_printer; instr_repeat = false; instr_help =
  1156. "stop using the given function for printing values of its input type." }
  1157. ];
  1158.   variable_list := [
  1159.     (* variable name, (writing, reading), help reading, help writing *)
  1160.      { var_name = "arguments";
  1161.        var_action = raw_line_variable true arguments;
  1162.        var_help =
  1163. "arguments to give program being debugged when it is started." };
  1164.      { var_name = "program";
  1165.        var_action = path_variable true program_name;
  1166.        var_help =
  1167. "name of program to be debugged." };
  1168.      { var_name = "loadingmode";
  1169.        var_action = loading_mode_variable ppf;
  1170.        var_help =
  1171. "mode of loading.\n\
  1172. It can be either:\n\
  1173.   direct: the program is directly called by the debugger.\n\
  1174.   runtime: the debugger execute `ocamlrun programname arguments\'.\n\
  1175.   manual: the program is not launched by the debugger,\n\
  1176.     but manually by the user." };
  1177.      { var_name = "processcount";
  1178.        var_action = integer_variable false 1 "Must be >= 1."
  1179.                                      checkpoint_max_count;
  1180.        var_help =
  1181. "maximum number of process to keep." };
  1182.      { var_name = "checkpoints";
  1183.        var_action = boolean_variable false make_checkpoints;
  1184.        var_help =
  1185. "whether to make checkpoints or not." };
  1186.      { var_name = "bigstep";
  1187.        var_action = int64_variable false _1 "Must be >= 1."
  1188.                                      checkpoint_big_step;
  1189.        var_help =
  1190. "step between checkpoints during long displacements." };
  1191.      { var_name = "smallstep";
  1192.        var_action = int64_variable false _1 "Must be >= 1."
  1193.                                      checkpoint_small_step;
  1194.        var_help =
  1195. "step between checkpoints during small displacements." };
  1196.      { var_name = "socket";
  1197.        var_action = raw_variable true socket_name;
  1198.        var_help =
  1199. "name of the socket used by communications debugger-runtime." };
  1200.      { var_name = "history";
  1201.        var_action = integer_variable false 0 "" history_size;
  1202.        var_help =
  1203. "history size." };
  1204.      { var_name = "print_depth";
  1205.        var_action = integer_variable false 1 "Must be at least 1"
  1206.                                      max_printer_depth;
  1207.        var_help =
  1208. "maximal depth for printing of values." };
  1209.      { var_name = "print_length";
  1210.        var_action = integer_variable false 1 "Must be at least 1"
  1211.                                      max_printer_steps;
  1212.        var_help =
  1213. "maximal number of value nodes printed." };
  1214.      { var_name = "follow_fork_mode";
  1215.        var_action = follow_fork_variable;
  1216.        var_help =
  1217. "process to follow after forking.\n\
  1218. It can be either :\n\
  1219.   child: the newly created process.\n\
  1220.   parent: the process that called fork.\n" };
  1221.      { var_name = "break_on_load";
  1222.        var_action = boolean_variable false break_on_load;
  1223.        var_help =
  1224. "whether to stop after loading new code (e.g. with Dynlink)." }];

  1226.   info_list :=
  1227.     (* info name, function, help *)
  1228.     [{ info_name = "modules";
  1229.        info_action = info_modules ppf;
  1230.        info_help = "list opened modules." };
  1231.      { info_name = "checkpoints";
  1232.        info_action = info_checkpoints ppf;
  1233.        info_help = "list checkpoints." };
  1234.      { info_name = "breakpoints";
  1235.        info_action = info_breakpoints ppf;
  1236.        info_help = "list breakpoints." };
  1237.      { info_name = "events";
  1238.        info_action = info_events ppf;
  1239.        info_help = "list events in MODULE (default is current module)." }]

  1241. let _ = init std_formatter
